isis.stitle: FRONT DRIVE AXLE WHEEL ENDS: FABCO SDA-12 - DISASSEMBLY - HUB, DRUM AND WHEEL BEARING REMOVAL

svcproc.title: HUB, DRUM AND WHEEL BEARING REMOVAL

step1.para: Raise the front of the vehicle with a jack and secure vehicle with floor stands.
Remove the brake drum (disc wheel style hubs only).
With the end turned to full steering lock, remove the bolt and washer retaining the outer drive yoke (refer to Figure 2).
Remove the nuts from the outer axle shaft drive studs.
The flange should be loose enough to remove by hand. If not, use suitable bolts in the extractor holes to remove the outer axle shaft (refer to Figure 3).

note.para: If oil is used for wheel bearing lubrication, care should be exercised to protect brake linings, etc.

step1.para: Remove the wheel bearing lock nut (as shown in Figure 4). Then remove the lockwasher from spindle. Loosen wheel bearing adjusting nut as shown in Figure 18.

Rock hub lightly to loosen the outer wheel bearing cone. Remove the cone and protect it from dirt. If wheel bearings are oil lubricated, some oil may fall on the brake shoe when the hub is removed in the next step, unless suitable protection is used.

Lift the hub (or hub and drum assembly) off the spindle, ( Figure 19) using care to avoid damage to the bearing surfaces and to the threads. Wipe off any oil that may have reached the brake shoe before it reaches the lining.
Do not remove the axle shaft studs unless replacing them.
Remove the hub seal from the hub and discard.
Remove the inner wheel bearing cone and protect it from dirt.
Cover the spindle with a clean shop rag to protect it from damage.
Press wheel bearing cups from hub, if replacement is necessary.

svcproc.para: This is the limit of what is termed routine disassembly. It allows access to brakes for relining and to wheel bearings for repacking.
